text.name: system_description
text.text: The Nintendo GameCube was the first Nintendo console to use optical discs as its primary storage medium. In contrast with the GameCube's contemporary competitors, Sony's PlayStation 2, Sega's Dreamcast and Microsoft's Xbox, the GameCube uses miniDVD-based discs instead of full-size DVDs. In addition, the GameCube introduced support for online play, via the Nintendo GameCube Broadband Adapter and Modem Adapter (sold separately).
